page.title: 03IN SERVICE AT BUNNY HALL
page.content: Minnie Young left school at the age of 13 in 1922 and went to work for the Cordeaux family at Bunny Hall. She was employed as a parlour maid and she had her own room. It was hard work. Minnie got up at 7.00 a.m. and lay the table for breakfast, then she would clean and polish the silver and china. After that she would change her clothes for a black uniform, a white cap and apron to serve luncheon. At about 3.00 p.m. Minnie would serve tea to Mrs.Cordeaux and sometimes to Dr. Cordeaux. At 7.00 p.m. the gong would ring for dinner and everyone would be there. The table could hold twenty and Minnie helped to serve. At about 8.00 p.m. Minnie would go to bed. There were other servants in the house plus Billy a stable lad and Parks the chauffeur who drove the Rolls Royce and Daimler.
